Classes module

class Classes.Course(course_id, course_name, instructor)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a course with assigned students and instructor.

Parameters:

  • course_id (str) – The unique identifier for the course.

  • course_name (str) – The name of the course.

  • instructor (Instructor) – The instructor responsible for the course.

add_student(student)[source]

Adds a student to the course if not already enrolled.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student to enroll in the course.

Returns:

None

class Classes.Instructor(name, age, email, instructor_id)[source]

Bases: Person

Represents an instructor, a specialized type of Person.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the instructor.

  • age (int) – The age of the instructor.

  • email (str) – The email of the instructor.

  • instructor_id (str) – The unique identifier for the instructor.

assign_course(course)[source]

Assigns a course to the instructor if not already assigned.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to assign.

Returns:

None

class Classes.Person(name, age, email)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a generic person.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the person.

  • age (int) – The age of the person, must be a valid integer.

  • email (str) – The email of the person, must be a valid email format.

Raises:

ValueError – Raises an exception if the age or email is invalid.

introduce()[source]

Prints a greeting message from the person.

Returns:

None

class Classes.Student(name, age, email, student_id)[source]

Bases: Person

Represents a student, a specialized type of Person.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the student.

  • age (int) – The age of the student.

  • email (str) – The email of the student.

  • student_id (str) – The unique identifier for the student.

register_course(course)[source]

Registers the student in a course if not already registered.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course to register the student in.

Returns:

None

Classes.load_data_from_file(filename)[source]

Loads data related to an instructor, their courses, and students from a JSON file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The filename from which the data will be loaded.

Returns:

A tuple containing the loaded instructor, list of courses, and list of students.

Return type:

tuple (Instructor, list of Course, list of Student)

Classes.save_data_to_file(instructor, courses, students, filename)[source]

Saves data related to an instructor, their courses, and students to a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • instructor (Instructor) – The instructor whose data is to be saved.

  • courses (list of Course) – List of courses taught by the instructor.

  • students (list of Student) – List of students enrolled in the courses.

  • filename (str) – The filename where the data will be saved.

Returns:

None

Classes.validate_age(age)[source]

Validates that the provided age is a non-negative integer.

Parameters:

age (int) – The age to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If age is not an integer or if it is negative.

Returns:

True if the age is a valid non-negative integer.

Return type:

bool

Classes.validate_email(email)[source]

Validates that the provided email address conforms to a standard email format.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If the email does not match the standard email format.

Returns:

True if the email format is valid.

Return type:

bool
